name: Battle of the Golden Tooth
summary: "Leading a host of 30
column29: 000 troops from the Westerlands Ser Jaime Lannister is ordered to attack the Riverlands by his father Tywin Lannister. The assault is intended as retribution for the abduction of Tyrion Lannister by Catelyn Stark
column31: the ruling house of the Riverlands. The Riverlords gathered to defend themselves at the Golden Tooth
column32: where they were defeated by Jaime's forces
column33: and retreated to the regional capital of Riverrun. Jaime harried their retreat and then laid siege to Riverrun."

name: Battle at the Mummer's Ford
summary: "The Battle at the Mummer's Ford was a military engagement in the first days of the War of the Five Kings. It takes place when the forces of House Lannister led by Ser Gregor Clegane come into conflict with the Iron Throne detachment sent by Hand of the King Eddard Stark
column29: under the leadership of Lord Beric Dondarrion along with Thoros of Myr
column30: to execute Ser Gregor. It results in the victory of Ser Gregor Clegane and the first death of Lord Beric Dondarrion
column31: who is resurrected after the battle."

name: Battle of Riverrun
summary: "After defeating the Riverlords at the Golden Tooth
column29: a Lannister host led by Ser Jaime Lannister pushes into the Riverlands to lay siege to Riverrun
column30: the ancestral seat of House Tully. The Lannister host keeps laying siege on Riverrun until Jaime's host is lured away and defeated in the Battle of the Whispering Wood
column31: while the remaining Lannister force is defeated at the Battle of the Camps."

name: Battle of the Green Fork
attacker_commander: Roose Bolton, Wylis Manderly, Medger Cerwyn, Harrion Karstark, Halys Hornwood
defender_commander: Tywin Lannister, Gregor Clegane, Kevan Lannister, Addam Marbrand
summary: "Leading a host of 18
column30: Robb Stark means to confront the Lannister armies in the Riverlands and relieve the forces loyal to his grandfather which have been under attack for some time. Lord Tywin Lannister has split his forces into two armies
column33: under the command of Jaime Lannister
column35: the seat of House Tully. The other
column38: along the west bank of the Green Fork of the River Trident
column39: to prevent the Starks from lifting the siege
column40: and sends scouts to reconnoiter the Stark position."

name: Battle of the Whispering Wood
summary: "The Battle of the Whispering Wood and the following slaughter of the Lannister forces besieging Riverrun essentially destroy half of the Lannister standing army
column29: removing their second functional army-group within the Riverlands. This leaves Lord Tywin with only the 30
column30: 000 strong army under his own command further to the east. Recognizing that the situation is lost
column31: Tywin decides to pull back his army further south in the Riverlands to Harrenhal on the shores of the God's Eye lake
column32: in order to use that castle as a base of operations for a protracted war."

name: Battle of the Camps
attacker_commander: Robb Stark, Tytos Blackwood, Brynden Tully
summary: "Following immediately after Robb Stark's ambush of Ser Jaime Lannister's cavalry at the Battle of the Whispering Wood
column29: Robb Stark made a surprise night-time assault on the main army besieging Riverrun. The Lannister army
column30: being leaderless after the capture of Jaime Lannister during the immediately preceding Battle of the Whispering Wood
column31: was caught asleep in their camps and were easily slaughtered."

name: Battle of Deepwood Motte
summary: "The First Battle of Deepwood Motte was a battle during the War of the Five Kings. It was part of the campaign orchestrated by Balon Greyjoy - who had crowned himself King of the Iron Islands - to conquer the North. Following her father's orders
column29: Yara Greyjoy takes thirty longships of the Iron Fleet to seize the seat of House Glover. Later
column30: Deepwood Motte is retaken by Glover forces with the support of House Bolton."

name: Battle of the Stony Shore
note: Greyjoy's troop number based on the Battle of Deepwood Motte, in which Asha had 1000 soldier on 30 longships. That comes out to ~33 per longship. In the Battle of the Stony Shore, Theon has 8 longships, and just we can estimate that he has 8*33 =265 troops.
summary: "As part of his campaign to seize the North during the War of the Five Kings
column29: Balon Greyjoy orders Theon to raid the fishing villages of the Stony Shore."

name: Battle of Torrhen's Square
note: Greyjoy's troop number comes from the 264 estimate to have arrived on the stony shore minus the 20 Theon takes to attack Winterfell. Thus 264-20=244
summary: "The Raid on Torrhen's Square is a battle during the War of the Five Kings. It is part of a ploy by Theon Greyjoy - who had abandoned House Stark and aligned himself with his father Balon Greyjoy
column29: the self-fashioned King of the Iron Islands - to seize Winterfell and gain the respect of his father and fellow ironborn."

name: Battle of Winterfell
note: It isn't mentioned how many Stark men are left in Winterfell, other than "very few".
summary: "The Fall of Winterfell was an event during the War of the Five Kings. To gain the respect of his fellow ironborn and his father
column29: Theon Greyjoy turned on the Starks and seized the undefended castle. It was not so much a battle as a surprise seizure of Winterfell when virtually all of its guards had been lured away due to a feint at Torrhen's Square."

name: Sack of Winterfell
defender_commander: Rodrik Cassel, Cley Cerwyn, Leobald Tallhart
note: Since House Bolton betrays the Starks for House Lannister, we code this battle as between these two houses. Greyjoy men, numbering only 20, don't play a major part in the fighting and end up dying anyway.
summary: "The Fall of Winterfell was an event during the War of the Five Kings. To gain the respect of his fellow ironborn and his father
column29: Theon Greyjoy turned on the Starks and seized the undefended castle. It was not so much a battle as a surprise seizure of Winterfell when virtually all of its guards had been lured away due to a feint at Torrhen's Square."

name: Battle of Oxcross
defender_commander: Stafford Lannister, Roland Crakehall, Antario Jast
summary: "The Battle of Oxcross is a major engagement in the War of the Five Kings. The army of House Stark in the Riverlands moves into the Westerlands to attack a host of House Lannister reinforcements camped near the town of Oxcross.[1] Following through on King Robb Stark's promise to Queen Cersei that he would litter the south with Lannister dead
column29: [2] the battle was a decisive Stark victory with the Lannister host under the command of Ser Stafford Lannister destroyed and Stafford himself killed."

name: Siege of Storm's End
defender_commander: Renly Baratheon, Cortnay Penrose, Loras Tyrell, Randyll Tarly, Mathis Rowan
summary: "The Siege of Storm's End was a year-long siege during Robert's Rebellion that took place concurrently with much of the war. It was carried out by the forces of the Reach led by House Tyrell against the garrison of Storm's End."

name: Battle of the Fords
attacker_commander: Tywin Lannister, Flement Brax, Gregor Clegane, Addam Marbrand, Lyle Crakehall, Leo Lefford
defender_commander: Edmure Tully, Jason Mallister, Karyl Vance

name: Sack of Harrenhal
attacker_commander: Roose Bolton, Vargo Hoat, Robett Glover

name: Battle of the Crag
attacker_commander: Robb Stark, Smalljon Umber, Black Walder Frey
summary: "The Surrender of the Crag is an event in the War of the Five Kings. The army of House Stark in the Westerlands maintains its camp after the victory at the Battle of the Yellow Fork while King Robb Stark travels to the Crag with a small force to negotiate their surrender and take on supplies."

name: Battle of the Blackwater
attacker_commander: Stannis Baratheon, Imry Florent, Guyard Morrigen, Rolland Storm, Salladhor Saan, Davos Seaworth
defender_commander: Tyrion Lannister, Jacelyn Bywater, Sandor Clegane, Tywin Lannister, Garlan Tyrell, Mace Tyrell, Randyll Tarly
summary: "The battle was an attempt by Stannis Baratheon
column29: brother of the late King Robert Baratheon
column31: the capital of the Seven Kingdoms
column32: and to seize the Iron Throne from King Joffrey Baratheon. It required a naval assault and an attack on the city gates by land. Tyrion Lannister
column34: led the defense of the city. He successfully destroyed a large portion of Stannis's fleet through the use of wildfire
column35: but was unable to prevent Stannis's army from landing and gaining the walls of the city. However
column36: late-arriving reinforcements under Lord Tywin Lannister
column38: and Ser Loras Tyrell defeated Stannis's army
column39: resulting in a decisive Lannister-Tyrell victory in King Joffrey's name."

name: The Red Wedding
attacker_commander: Walder Frey, Roose Bolton, Walder Rivers
note: This observation refers to the battle against the Stark men, not the attack on the wedding
summary: "The Red Wedding was a massacre that happened during the War of the Five Kings arranged by Lord Walder Frey as revenge against King Robb Stark for breaking the marriage pact between House Stark and House Frey. During the massacre
column34: most of his bannermen and men-at-arms (~15
column35: 000 men) are murdered following the marriage feast and bedding of Edmure Tully

name: Battle of Castle Black
attacker_commander: Mance Rayder, Tormund Giantsbane, Harma Dogshead, Magnar Styr, Varamyr
defender_commander: Stannis Baratheon, Jon Snow, Donal Noye, Cotter Pyke
summary: "The Battle of Castle Black
column29: also referred to as the Battle for the Wall
column30: is a battle during the Conflict Beyond the Wall and the War of the Five Kings
column31: the latter due to the intervention of Stannis Baratheon at the battle's end. Jon's successful leadership during the battle also leads to him being chosen as the new Lord Commander of the Night's Watch."

name: Retaking of Deepwood Motte
summary: "In response to Robb Stark's campaign to overthrow the Lannisters and establish Northern independence
column29: Balon Greyjoy takes the opportunity to attack the poorly-defended North
column32: take thirty ships to attack and take Deepwood Motte. As Deepwood Motte was the last Northern castle held by the ironborn
column33: this effectively marks the end of Balon's occupation of the North
column34: all of his men having been driven out by either House Bolton or the local northern Houses. Though Balon vows to strike back
column35: he is killed shortly afterwards by his own younger brother

name: Invasion of Ryamsport, Vinetown, and Starfish Harbor
Siege of Riverrun
attacker_commander: Daven Lannister, Ryman Fey, Jaime Lannister
summary: "The Second Siege of Riverrun is a siege during the War of the Five Kings. Granted to House Frey after the downfall of House Tully at the Red Wedding
column29: Riverrun was eventually recaptured by Ser Brynden Tully "the Blackfish" and an assembled force of Tully loyalists. House Frey launched an attempt to retake the castle which was met with failure until reinforcements of House Lannister arrived from the south. This army group
column30: commanded by Ser Jaime Lannister in the name of King Tommen I
column31: successfully took back Riverrun with the only casualty being that of the Blackfish himself."

name: Siege of Winterfell
summary: "After news of the Fall of Winterfell to a band of ironborn led by Theon Greyjoy and the death of Ser Rodrik Cassel reached Robb Stark
column31: offers to send word to his bastard son to gather a force to retake Winterfell. Ramsay's deception kept King Robb and his mother Catelyn from realizing that it was truly Ramsay and his Bolton soldiers who burned Winterfell. Robb had no idea that the Boltons had turned on him until months later at the betrayal of the Red Wedding
column32: when Roose personally drove a dagger through his heart."
